Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dated and slightly run down in places hotel. Good if you can get a cheap deal.”
Reviews.Author: Michael2998
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in April 2012 with our 4 month old baby. Reception staff were good and friendly. Room was of a good size but the decor was dated, dirty and damaged in places. No central heating only electric wall heaters. If you like tv they have a large screen in your room (maybe a smaller wall mounted tv would suit this sized room). There is a general lack of plugs in the room, and the 'hospitality' tray could be improved. No fridge which was needed to keep baby food chilled and no suitable bin for used nappies. Breakfast was good with a variety of different food available. 1 member of staff was very short and sharp and seemed to lack a general liking of people (could have been just a bad morning).

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Harriet_R_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend as we were going to a gig at Alexandra Palace. It was very good value for London and the staff were all friendly and helpful. It wasn't luxurious but for £50/ night I didn't expect it to be! The only negative was that our bedroom window didn't shut properly and despite mentioning it at reception this was not addressed. Luckily the room was very warm anyway. It's also worth noting that if you turn up for breakfast after 9.30, there will be limited choice for the hot food. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin and is better than other "budget" hotels”
Reviews.Author: lavcott
Reviews.Content: Breakfast included in price & good choice of food. Good location. Clean room. Friendly Staff. Better value for money than most "budget" hotels Stayed there for last 4 years at same time of year and service/cleanliness consistent

Reviews.Title: “good value, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on several occasions and have always found it comfortable, clean and convenient, even if it lacks the finer finish. The rooms are always clean and provide everything needed although the decor is in need of updating and the curtains may be torn. The bedrooms are of a good size, with plenty of towels, pillows, rubber bath mat, etc all provided without having to ask. The breakfast is good and in particular the eggs are well cooked. The staff are friendly and helpful and the service good. Parking overnight however can sometimes be a problem with not enough spaces when the hotel is full. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Really Impressed”
Reviews.Author: TheChicken_2012
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for one night, as we were attending a gig at The Alexander Palace. Checked in quickly, friendly staff greeted us. We were given a room on 2nd floor. Great size accommodation, Huge (and I mean huge) comfy bed, flat screen tv (not great picture but watchable). Decor probably in need of update, but we found everthing to be clean and comfortable. En-suite also clean, towlels on the small side but they always are! The only thing I could mention is the shower curtain, I personally hate the things and this one was looking a little grubby at the bottom. But the shower was decent power and nice and hot. Speaking of heat, I would definatly suggest turning off the heater in the room at night. After a very chilly walk across town (-10C) we were in need of some heat and decided to leave the heater on when we went to bed. We woke about an hour later in sweltering heat and had to sleep with the window open for the rest of the night just to cool us down again. Our room was situated at the back of the hotel overlooking the car-park, so we didn't have any road noise. Not sure what a room at the front would be like as it is quite a busy road. Reception staff helpful and ordered us a taxi. (To the Alexander Palace about 3 miles away, charged £10). Breakfast in the morning was served between 8 and 10am on a Saturday, we arrived at 9.30am and the dining room was very busy. Quite a wait on cooked breakfast, but cereals, toast, fruit, juices and coffee were replenished quickly throughout the sitting. Overall, we found this to be a great value pit-stop hotel. Handy being so close (30sec walk!) to the leisure park too where you have a wide choice of restaurants from well known chains. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: V-Unit
Reviews.Content: My stay was for two nights. The overall service was ok and staff were generally friendly. The room was fairly clean though there were stains on the chair and cushion. The hotel building was fairly typical of a chain type hotel i.e. a fairly ugly facade and blandly decorated rooms but it was generally of a perfectly acceptable standard throughout. The breakfasts were reasonable with a good selection and ample dining area. The hotel is also in a good location with chain restaurants, vue cinema and bowling alley on the same site. The hotel has it's own restaurant though I did not gave a meal there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if going to Alexandra Palace”
Reviews.Author: brookie0079
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 23 December when we were going to see the darts at Alexandra Palace....location was good for access to the venue but beware taxi's try rip you off severly; tried to charge £19 for a 3 mile £8 trip! Hotel was ok, rooms were freezing though as heating was through this huge generator looking thing so couldn't have it on when in bed as it was so noisy! Hotel was clean, breakfast wasn't very good served until 10am so we went down at 9.40 as it was buffet so thought they'd be plenty but hardly anything left Booked hotel 6 months in advance and day before we stayed checked on price and it had reduced by £30 so cancelled and rebooked! Would stay again if going to the darts but that would be the only reason!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel with great restaurant attached”
Reviews.Author: Mimomeemo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now. Good points: - good size rooms with lots of storage space - reasonable price - clean - good tv and lots of channels - free wifi - delicious and friendly Mediterranean restaurant; eaten there three times. Love it. - on a leisure park with cinema, bowling and with other restaurants including tasty and decorative Mexican Chimichanga, Nandos and Cafe Rouge (and McDonalds) - adjoining rooms with doors in between good for families; you can lock them if you need a break from the kids! Less good points: - taps turning off the wrong way and with strong jet so you get drenched; it's only funny once! - broken toilet seat that couldn't be fixed due to xmas hols; they offered to move us but otherwise we were happy with the room - only one double socket. Tip: bring an adaptor with you - room smelled of smoke even though it's no smoking - fairly dire breakfast. How can a tomato be made so tasteless. Awful bacon and sausage. Nasty sliced bread and a toaster that either singes or only warms, doesn't toast. Only black tea or coffee, not choice of teas (eg green or earl grey). Blaring TV isn't what we all want first thing but there are two rooms so you can get away from it. Overall I would definitely recommend it and we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Big room with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Emma2788
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights needed to be close to Alexandra Palace. Room is big and reasonably clean. Staff are very helpful - ordering taxi's etc. Big breakfast included for 65 per night we paid. Has a few restaurants next door, as well as a cinema and bowling alley. Buses from the main road outside. Train station about a 15-20min walk. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good prices”
Reviews.Author: Domojacko
Reviews.Content: Just off the North Circ and next to a food & entertainment complex you cannot fault the location and value for money. Bedrooms are a good size with all the minimum requirements. Carpets not terribly clean and towels too thin. But hey, look at the cheap prices they charge. All staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for London break”
Reviews.Author: Skanks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night whilst in London for a music convention weekend. We paid just over £50 for B&B through lastminute.com and weren't expecting much but were pleasantly surprised. It was clean and the staff were friendly. We arrived early and the staff hurried to finish cleaning our room so that we could check in early which I thought was very accommodating of them. Parking was ample. The room had a kingsize bed, TV, tea/coffee making facilities and hairdryer. The bathroom was clean and the shower was nice and powerful. Being a mile from the tube at East Finchley wasn't ideal, but you can't have everything! Breakfast was a bit disappointing - the coffee wasn't great and the beans on the cooked breakfast were ice cold (probably just an oversight) but we just went off to one of the nearby cafes on our way into central London for a decent coffee-fix instead. We would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont know what more you want”
Reviews.Author: yidarmyKent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night 11/11 with the other half. We booked this through late rooms.com & paid £57(Bargain). Check in was quick & smooth, bedroom was clean, tidy & the beds were nice & comfy. The bar staff were great, & even brought us over peanuts with drinks. Breakfast was good, i certainly needed it, to soak up the beer. Would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel. Nov.5th 2011.”
Reviews.Author: CelticSoul58
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very easy to get to from the motorway and there is ample parking available, The staff on reception were pleasant and check in on arrival was pretty speedy. We had a king sized bed in a double room which cost £79 for one nights Bed and Breakfast, it's cheaper if you stay for more than one night. The bed was more comfortable than any of the budget hotels we have stayed in before and the bedding and towels were nice and clean. There was plenty of cupboard and hanging space in the room. A buffet of continental style or full English breakfast was served in the morning and you just had to find a table and help yourself, there was ample food for everyone and it was very nice. The only negative things I can say about the hotel is that there was a hair in the kettle and the bathroom had mould on the grout in between the tiles and the bath looked stained, the mixer taps on the sink were not very good as they did not mix the water properly because both jets of water came out of the tap separately. There seemed to be a lot of air lock in the water pipes as there were very loud noises during the night if anyone used the toilet or turned water the water on. That TV in the room had only channels 1-5 to choose from and the reception was very poor, but I think you may be able to pay to view extra channels as there was a pay T.V button on the controls. All in all a reasonable hotel if you are not staying long, if you want luxury there are other hotels from arounl £200+ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jax78
Reviews.Content: If you like sleeping with bed bugs, then this is your ideal hotel (see photos). This hotel is a typical modern, soulless travellers' type of hotel, in a good location for the North Circular road. Initially all seemed well, the room being superficially clean and well presented, with all the facilities you would expect (tea making equipment and hair drier neatly tucked away in draws, full en-suite, shelf for suitcase, open fronted wardrobe, small electric wall heater to supplement hidden room heating, large sliding window). There is a car park right outside the hotel. A small bar and Greek themed restraurant are located next to reception. A branch of Cafe Rouge is next door, serving fairly good French food, with a 10% discount for hotel guests. However, after getting up in the middle of the night to use the toilet, I was horrified to find about 8 bed bugs, which had obviously fed on my blood. To say this spoilt the previously good impression would be understating it! I and my work colleagues will be giving Comfort Hotels a wide berth from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel on outskirts of London”
Reviews.Author: stevevoidstar
Reviews.Content: All in all a decent hotel on the outskirts of London. Very good if you have a car as it is just off the North Circular and has quite a bit of parking outside. Otherwise it is a 1 mile walk through suburbia to West Finchley underground station. The surroundings are a bit soul-less - a main road and a leisure park with the usual chain restaurants, chain cinema and bowling alley. The room I stayed in was clean, large (a triple with a double and single) and quiet (away from the road). The bathroom was a decent size with a bath. The facilities in the room are basic - TV with poor reception (why does it seem impossible to provide a decent picture in hotels?)and tea and coffee facilities (though no biscuits). There is no mini-bar or iron and ironing board (though reception will provide one if you ask). The breakfast was decent rather than spectacular - self service hot and cold.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap Room in London”
Reviews.Author: kurrif
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as we were attending an exhibition and wanted a cheap room close to Alexandra palace and at £65 for two for one night it did exactly what it says on the tin. Room was spacious and comfortable if a bit bland but what do you expect at this price. As a crash pad for one night it suited us fine. The check in staff were a little "brusque" and the bar isnt exactly atmospheric. Position isnt very pretty on a dated leisure park with a cinema, Mcdonalds etc and the tube is a considerable hike away ( about 25 minutes walk), that being said if you turn right down Finchley high road and walk about 10 minutes there is a good selection of Indian and Chinese restaurants. So in conclusion I would say we got what we paid for and were very happy with that and would use again in those circumstance. If however you are on a tourist trip to London then the position and proximity to tubes probably make this a less good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dickyf Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Generally clean but sheets although washed were stained. Window didn't shut properly. Breakfast was good and good choice of full english,ceareals or toast. Wouldn't want to stay for a long period of time but was suitable for my needs which was was for somewhere to sleep only for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff... Unstocked bar... Unpleasant stay!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyMikeyMoo
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel for work nearby. The location of the hotel is good, plenty of places to eat on the nearby Leisure Park. The room was OK, relatively clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable and the shower powerful enough. The big problem with this hotel was the staff. They could not have been less helpful or friendly. The bar was being painted when I arrived and therefore there was no stock. A delivery had not arrived, due to the nearby riots myself and my colleague did not want to leave the area. When eventually we could find a drink to order it was good value for money. The second night I ordered the same drinks and was charged a different amount, when I questioned this the member of staff was rude and kept correcting me. Very poor service!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negatives...”
Reviews.Author: bubblestim
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful definately but quiet and great value for money (LateRooms at £65.00). Clean with everything you could want for a cheap stay in the capital. The walk to the tube was over a mile if you chose that but the 263 bus to East Finchley tube station was ok (£4.20 single which I thought was bloody dear!). It only took 35 minutes to get to the West End for a show from the hotel and the great thing about being outside the centre is the noise. The hotel was extremely quiet, the breakfast in the morning was superb (buffet full English) and the staff were very helpful. I wouldn't pay the norm for here, £119, West Ham United's Hotel is better value (£75 with full English and more central for tube access and to the sights) but for what it is, on this side of town, it's a great stay and somewhere I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Helouni
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel while visiting friends in London. It was in a good location with easy access to both North and Central Finchley. The accommodation was simple but clean and tidy and the staff were very friendly. There's not much else to say, it's a budget hotel and has the feel of one, but if you're looking for reasoably priced accommodation then it will more than suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: kessy2k1 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights and it was nice. The buffet breakfast was good and staff friendly. I particularly liked the fruits that were set out all day for guests. The only thing is I noticed the room was warm with no airconditioning. When I complained about this, a fan was sent up immediately. Though location is a little bit off from central london where I wanted to be, there was a busstop directly opposite the hotel that takes you straight to east fincley underground station. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, ample free parking, good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AishaSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Excellent value hotel. Large, very clean comfortable room. Decent bathroom and a good shower. The hotel is more of a lodge style, quite basic but was certainly adequate for our needs. Our room was very quiet and situated at the rear of the hotel. One gripe about the room - it needed more sockets! 2 sockets only, which if you have the kettle and TV on, mean you've nowhere to plug in mobile phones or laptops or hair appliances. Buffet style breakfast served 7am to 9am - not a huge choice but adequate and well cooked. Very busy between 8.30 and 9am with limited table space. (The hotel was at capacity when we stayed). Friendly, helpful and efficient staff. Plenty of free parking at the front and rear of the hotel. Location: Easy to find - a 15 minute journey from Junction 2 of the M1. Directly next to a leisure complex of restaurants including a 24hr McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Cafe Rouge, Nandos, Chimichanga, Ask and Vue cinema. There's also a David Lloyd fitness centre with pool. Regular buses (every 8-10 minutes) from a stop within approx 200 yards of the hotel, to take you to East Finchley (Northern Line) Tube Station. Tube trains every 3 minutes. Do buy an Oyster card or travel passes at the station, which can be used on all tubes, buses and trains - convenient and will save you £s! A very good value hotel, which we chose principally because of the good free parking. It is now our first choice to stay when visiting London. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & good value”
Reviews.Author: Domojacko
Reviews.Content: What you see is what you get but for £74 per night for double room is very good value with a Cafe Rouge nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheap & clean, fine for a night or two!”
Reviews.Author: artytarty
Reviews.Content: Having read recent reviews I was a tad worried, but after check in we were pleasantly surprised at the standard of cleanliness and the spacious room. Plenty of room for two adults and a large teenager. The bathroom was basic with a few tatty bits of tiling, but very clean and oodles of very hot water. Lovely cosy duvets and plenty of pillows. We had to change our room after the first night because some bugs had come in off a tree close by but this was our fault for leaving the window open. They moved us to another room, quickly and efficiently, all staff we met were helpful and polite except one of the breakfast staff who didn't seem to know what decaffeinated coffeee was or be bothered there were no teabags either! Breakfast was a help yourself buffet, bread and toast, cereals, yoghurt, juices, tinned grapefruit, bacon, sausages, tomatoes, bean,s scrambled and fried eggs, all great! The hotel is convenient to north London, Muswell Hill, Hampstead etc, though noisy at night if you have the window open. We didn't notice the aircon til we were leaving! So, its not a boutique hotel or particularly trendy or attractive, but if you want somewhere decent to sleep in comfort for a couple of nights then its ideal at £65 for 3 adults including breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Always clean and good value.”
Reviews.Author: housemartin33
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful, room has all we need. Not flashy but a convenient stop for us.Clean, but furnishings need updating. Has cinema and restaurants nearby as well as Leisure Centre; pay extra for the latter

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireMixter
Reviews.Content: Just had the one night at this place, as its located near our daughters house. We had a top floor room, by choice when we booked. The room was a good size, and clean - apart from a bit of mild 'wear and tear' here and there. The bathroom was also similarly clean, with plenty of hot water. The room window opened as far as we wanted, but as we were round the back, the view wasnt up to much - but that didnt matter for a night. The bed was very comfy and a good size. The TV however was out of the ark. Its a long time since ive seen a telly with a rounded screen! We found the room quiet, and had little noise from nearby rooms. The food at breakfast was more than edible, although the toaster was broken on this occasion. Also, as the hotel was quite busy, there wasnt enough tables for breakfast if everyone appeared at the same time. One real downer, was that on a Saturday night, the bar hadnt any red wine - unbelievable! We found the place good enough, and of a decent standard for what we paid - which was £80 for the night, particularly with the free parking outside.

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER go back here even if given the room for free!”
Reviews.Author: greekcypriot2009
Reviews.Content: I have booked it for just 2 nights because I wanted to be near our friends' house and regretted every minute of it. I have booked it for just 2 nights because I wanted to be near our friends' house. AND REGRETTED IT! Although it is a modern building and the rooms are quite spacious, yet there is one great disadvantage in this hotel. The ceiling is very low, and you can hear the people walking on the upper floor as if they are walking in your room. The walls are not made of brick, and it seems that you can have no privacy at all. There was a child or children jumping the whole afternoon on the upper rooms, and it was horrible. The corridors are very narrow, and although they are covered by carpet, you can hear your paces as if the floor is going to crack and open There was no air conditioning in the rooms, and the room had a wall to wall carpet. It was quite hot during the day –August. We tried to open one of the windows but it can only open 20 centimeters not more. It was very uncomfortable knowing that there was not much clean air coming in the room. Breakfast was normal. It is a kind of self service, but with adequate variety. You get the wrong directions from them. When we came we showed the paid voucher. We were given a room. The time we were leaving the reception insisted that we give them our credit card. I said that this cannot happen because they have already got paid. They had seen the voucher upon our arrival. They insisted. Somebody took it for 10 seconds, went into the inside room and brought it back to us. When back home, 2000 euros had been drawn from the card the bank informed us and goods had been purchased online. Of course I cannot blame 100% this hotel because those days we were in another hotel that did exactly the same thing. Anyway, I would never go to this hotel again even if I was given the room for free. I would recommend it just to those who have to make a stop in the area but not for anyone who visits London for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel cancelled my booking as they were "overbooked"”
Reviews.Author: ABergeron
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for my brother as he was coming from France for my wedding. I carefully choose this hotel as it was only 2 miles away from my wedding venue and that was really practical for him and his family to come over without having to worried about driving a long way back to his hotel at the end of the evening. The hotel cancelled my booking and even worst did not show any sign of empathy and hardly apologised for the inconveniance. They thought it was acceptable to book them instead at a hotel 10 miles away and were not even ready to discuss the possibility of accomadating them. I have not seen the hotel so I can't really give it a mark! I will never book again wih confort inn as when I plan a holiday or a break, I want to be able to rely on a hotel. I have travelled a lot and I never had a last minute cancellation from a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “It's Comfortable at the Comfort Inn.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Hi, myself and my wife stayed here for two nights. We found the hotel adequate all round. We had no issues to report at all. Staff were friendly and efficient. Well done to the CEO of this hotel chain for picking up the comments on Trip Advisor. Two suggestions I'd like to make are 1. We found it difficult to find the hotel on the exit 1000A as we couldn't see the hotel sign from the road due to greenery. My TOMTOM satnav brought me to Sandringham gardens. Therefore I would suggest better signage at the gate of the Leisure park entrance. 2. Finishing breakfast at 9.00AM is fine for people staying on business but for people on a leisure break its very early. As a further note I'd just like to say the hotel is situated in Finchley and we found the multicultural mix of peoples in Finchley to be really great and refreshing in the way that they all got on with each other and we were made to feel welcome every where we went. Access to London is via the Tube. We walked to the Tube station and it took around 15-20 mins. The tube into London center took another 25 mins. We would certainly use this hotel again and others from this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfy - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: angellea69
Reviews.Content: We spent two pleasant nights at the Finchley Comfort Inn earlier this month. Our double room was fine - clean and comfy, with a powerful shower. Others in our group had twin rooms, which also had air con and a fridge which was a bonus. Our double bed was actually two twins pushed together, which was fine for us. It made the bed huge! Free wifi was also available. The rest of the hotel was also clean and comfy, the staff were pleasant and the bar staye dopen as long as we wanted to stay up: bonus! The prices were also very reasonable for a North London hotel - £2.80 for Boddingtons & £3.00 for a pint of lager. There was a McDonald's, Cafe Rouge, Nando's, cinema, bowling alley & other restaurants on the same site as the hotel, which was brilliant. The only real down side is that the hotel is over a mile away from the nearest tube station, so we got taxis there - but local cab firms were prompt, polite and good value for London. I would definitely stay here again - only 20 mins from Central London by tube, offered free parking, had a lovely breakfast and a good value bar. Great!

Reviews.Title: “great base”
Reviews.Author: baileysclan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on monday night and it was fine, its location is great right next to a selection of restaurants offering a range of things to eat from a burger to an italian. Bus stop right outside and if you need to go to the tube station its 263 and costs £2. Hotel staff were all pleasant check in took 5 minutes and questions we had were answered effieciently., Room was massive, we had recently stayed elsewhere paid more for a tiny room so was impressed. Paid £59 through octopus travel so most impressed once again. The bed was big and comfy although on the hottest day of the year we had to kick off the duvet as it was a bit big and bulky. Breakfast and parking were included in this price and we went to eat about 8.45am just before it was due to finish and it was still fresh and hot and tasty, although as usual toasters are sooo slow your breakfast got a little chilly waiting for it. Checking out was fine and simple once again pleasent staff and a check out of 11am was a bonus when your on a leisure break so thank you for that. All in all a great clean hotel ideally situated with pleasent staff and good surroundings

Reviews.Title: “Extra bed not supplied as stated!!!”
Reviews.Author: stafdal
Reviews.Content: Venue was ok for a short break, little bits of maintenance needed. Breakfast was good and plentiful. However, I was staying with a 9 & 11 year old and the extra fold out bed was not supplied as stated in reservation. Kids were tired on arrival so just made do with what was there. Not a comfortable night. I think try as they might in other areas, but they should get the most basic of amenities right 'a bed'!!!!. I had contacted their customer services 'Choice Hotels' about a query prior to arrival, but still had no response to this day. If you stay with kids, go prepared, take an extra!!

Reviews.Title: “Good functional budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeamStevo
Reviews.Content: We live in Finchley and stayed here for a night while our heating was being repaired. This is a thoroughly good, effecient, clean, pleasant, little place, very similar to Premier Inn standard but a little cheaper. Don't expect frills but there is nothing at all wrong with this place. One good extra was that residents get a discount at the nearby Cafe Rouge for meals. Our room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was fine and the breakfast was a good self service, eat all your want type buffet. If i ever had to stay for a night away from home and wanted somewhere basic and local, I would not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, not close to a tube station”
Reviews.Author: LS13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times as its handy for the M1 and has lots of free parking. Its a standard chain hotel, clean a nd functional. Situated in Finchley North London about 7 miles from the centre, its next to a leisure park with bowling alley, cinema and a number of chain restaurants so if you're staying for one night only theres no need to go to central london. If you do need to go into the centre, the nearest tube station is East Finchley on the Northern Line. Thats about a 25 minute walk, though there is a bus which runs every 10 minutes or so (less often on sunday). Once on the tube it takes about 20 minutes to get to the west end. Breakfast was included in the internet rate I got and was full english on a buffet basis--it was ok, not great, but buffets seldom are. My only problem with the hotel was the bed which was one of the least comfy I think I've ever encountered. I could feel the springs/ ridges of the mattress and had to lay on top of the quilt to make it more comfy . In summary, Ok chain hotel and not a bad price for proximity to London. Ok for a night but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but far away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: BiancaBeatrice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very chic and clean. The services are very good, the breakfast was varied. The only inconvenience was the location. The hotel is too far from the city centre. We took 1 bus and 2 underground lines.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: magscribbler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once a week for about three months on business and got to know the place and staff quite well. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The 'all you can eat' breakfast buffet is great if you like a cooked breakfast (which I do). It's generally quiet at night but some rooms are more prone to noise from plumbing/corridor. My only grumble is that although the staff are incredibly helpful, professional and friendly, the computer booking system isn't reliable - I had a favourite room that I'd pre book and confirm in advance every week only to find when I checked in the that computer had randomly allocated me another one. Other than that, great.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonHarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2008; and to be quite honest I am staggered by the number of positive reviews on this site. Sadly, I rate this place as one of the worst hotels I've ever had to stay in and struggle to find anything positive to say about the place. The whole place is shabby and tired and I agree with the comments regarding the single very slow lift and the distance to walk to some rooms. On the nights I stayed there the number of vans in the car park outnumbered the cars by about ten to one which says it all in my book. Perhaps I just caught it on a bad week though. My first room smelt as though someone had chain smoked all night on the previous day and after complaining I was moved to another room. Although the air was fresher the room was tired, the bathroom grubby and the bed hard and uncomfortable. The peeling formica on the sticky breakfast table was probably the final straw; my colleague and I both complained to our company and will not be staying here again. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1punjabi
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the comfort, location/parking was excellent, the staff were polite/helpfull, (especially christian) rooms were clean, breakfast was great with a good choice, deffinately use this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Hotel Finchley
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Leisure Way, High Road | Finchley, London N12 0Q2, England
